page.title: 18 Home Renovation
page.content: Most Glasgow people used to live in tenements built of sandstone about ninety years ago. Some of the tenements became shabby and even dangerous so the Council pulled many of them down and built new high flats instead. Then people realised that it would be better to renovate the old tenements, and this is still going on. When a flat is renovated, some families are found a new home temporarily, but others have to live with all the muddle. Any rotten woodwork is replaced, the outside walls are cleaned, the rooms are re-wired and sinks, roofs, bathroom suites and windows are all renewed. This all usually takes about three months, but it is worth the inconvenience because people like living in old tenements.
